arch:property.oc:show_val: 22.75 m east west from middle of Pier 1 to west edge-by-1.30 m north south.
Closing elevation: 892.842 m (bottom visible from Colonnaded Street).

Phase II: First period of major Nabataean construction at the Great Temple complex in the 1st c. BCE. Portico Wall of the Propylaeum built. Construction of the lowest eight steps leading up from the then sand and gravel path to a landing, which may have been the site of an early altar.
North boundary of Trench 87 next to Colonnaded Street.

Part of the original construction of the downtown area of Petra, this wall predates the temple complex and extends for most of the distance of the central thoroughfare. According to Parr, it predates the Colonnaded Street, and was a terracing wall along an older, Nabataean road. The length measurement includes the entirety of the Portico Wall, including Room 1.
